title: Product Design & Feature Definition
intro: Transform your market positioning into a tangible product concept. Define your Minimum Viable Product (MVP), core features, and user experience that delivers on your value proposition while staying focused on your target customer's most critical needs.

fields.label: Core User Story
fields.placeholder: As a [user type], I want to [accomplish goal] so that [benefit achieved]
fields.help: Primary user story your product solves

fields.label: Key User Journey
fields.placeholder: 1. User signs up 2. Completes onboarding 3. Sets up first project...
fields.help: Step-by-step user experience from first use to value realization

fields.label: Success Metrics
fields.placeholder: e.g., User completes setup in <5 minutes, 80% feature adoption in first week

promptTemplate:
**ROLE**

You are a product designer and strategist creating a comprehensive product specification.

**CONTEXT**

Company: {{phase1.company_name}}
Target Customer: {{phase3.target_customer}}
Core Problem: {{phase3.core_problem}}
Unique Approach: {{phase3.unique_approach}}
Positioning: {{phase3.positioning_statement}}

Product Type: {{product_type}}
Core User Story: {{core_user_story}}

**TASK**

Create a comprehensive product design document including:

1. **Product Overview**
   - Product vision and mission
   - How it delivers on our value proposition: {{phase3.key_benefit_1}} and {{phase3.key_benefit_2}}
   - Target user personas and use cases

2. **MVP Feature Specification**
   - {{mvp_feature_1}}: Detailed description, user stories, acceptance criteria
   - {{mvp_feature_2}}: Detailed description, user stories, acceptance criteria  
   - {{mvp_feature_3}}: Detailed description, user stories, acceptance criteria
   - Feature prioritization rationale

3. **User Experience Design**
   - User journey map: {{user_journey}}
   - Key user flows and wireframe descriptions
   - Information architecture
   - UI/UX principles aligned with {{phase1.primary_color}} and {{phase1.secondary_color}} brand colors

4. **Technical Architecture**
   - High-level system architecture
   - Technology stack recommendations
   - Integration requirements
   - Scalability considerations

5. **Success Criteria & Metrics**
   - {{success_metrics}}
   - Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
   - User feedback collection methods
   - Iteration and improvement plan

6. **Development Roadmap**
   - MVP development timeline (8-12 weeks)
   - Resource requirements
   - Risk mitigation strategies
   - Post-MVP feature pipeline

**OUTPUT FORMAT**

Detailed product specification document in markdown format, suitable for development teams and stakeholders.
instructions: Focus on solving the core problem identified in your positioning
Keep MVP features minimal but complete for your key user story
Design user experience that delivers your promised benefits
Create development-ready specifications for your technical team
